sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Authorities began cases against Tikhanovskaya and other Belarus opposition figures after disputed elections in 2020, which led to mass protests and a corresponding brutal crackdown. The court also handed down an 18-year sentence in a penal colony to Pavel Latushko, who's in exile.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Russia claims it is tightening its hold on the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut, with constant pounding on the main routes in and out of the city.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian forces still control Bakhmut, but a top commander described the situation as hell, although his forces claim to have stabilized the front lines on the outskirts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In his nightly address, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Kyiv's troops were in a quote, painful and difficult battle in the eastern Donbas region, including Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11

sentences.sentence: defense of Bakhmut remains strategically sound that is continues to consume Russian manpower and equipment as long as Ukrainian forces do not suffer excessive casualties. The Institute for the Study of War says Ukrainian forces are unlikely to withdraw from Bakhmut all at once and may pursue a gradual fighting withdrawal to exhaust Russian forces through continued urban warfare now the think tank says Russian forces are unlikely to quickly secure significant territorial gains when conducting urban warfare which usually favors the defender the Bakhmut city center is located on the western bank of the Bakhmut Kar center is located on the western bank of the Bakhmutka river and Russian forces will need to fight through the area if they are unable to advance directly north or south of Bakhmut to the west of the city center after nine months of highly attritional slow Russian advances in this area. The institute for the study of war says it is still too early to assess Ukrainian intentions concerning a complete withdrawal from the city. In this area, Ukrainian forces are holding their positions with a distance of around four kilometers apart. The Russian offensive to capture Bakhmut will likely culminate whether Russian forces capture the city or not, and the Russian military will likely struggle to maintain any subsequent offensive operations for some months. The Institute for the Study of War adds the likely imminent culmination of the Russian offensive around Bakhmut, the already culminated Russian offensive around Vuhladar, and the stalling Russian offensive in Luhansk region are likely setting robust conditions for Ukrainian counter-offensive operations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.sentence: The historic heart of Antakya is completely in ruins.

sentences.sentence: The earthquake has affected 14 million people, one-sixth of the population.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Of these, 3.3 million have had to leave the affected areas, according to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The environment is good, but it is small. Unfortunately, because of the earthquake, it is not as good as it could be. The 7.8 magnitude earthquake followed nine hours later by another 7.6 magnitude quake killed nearly 46,000 people and injured 105,000 in Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: MALCOLM BRABANT, First the European Parliament, now the European Commission, as the E.U.'s

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: trouble related to Qatar continues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The bloc's watchdog has asked the commission to provide details on business trips made by its senior members, after the director general of its transport department, Heinrich Hollerley, reportedly traveled several times at the expense of the Qatari government.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: It happened while the commission was negotiating an E.U.-Qatar air transport agreement that now allows all Qatari airlines to operate direct flights to and from any European airport, and vice versa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Commission recognised that the trips were paid by Qatar, but denies any conflict of interest, given that Heinrich Hollerley was not directly involved in the negotiations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Either way, these kinds of invitations have to be cleared, and in this case, it was Hollerley himself who authorised the trips.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: When it comes to the Director General, as head of department, he is in charge of assessing whether there is a potential for conflict of interest involved in the mission that we are talking about.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So in other words, he himself is the authorising officer who is supposed to conduct this analysis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: This is the authorizing officer who is supposed to conduct this analysis. This is the procedure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: While the EU watchdog chief Emily O'Reilly underlines how the direct general ultimately takes responsibility for these negotiations, some MEPs in the European Parliament are pushing for absolute clarity on the matter. La Commission aujourd'hui reconnaît qu'il y a un problème de fonctionnement, notamment avec ses règles internes de voyage, et notamment de ses fonctionnaires.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Et donc j'espère que ça va avancer dans le bon sens, notamment pour la transparence sur ces questions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: La Commission européenne a jusqu'en juin à répondre aux questions de l'Ombudsman de l'UE, en faisant sa recherche. The European Commission has until June to answer the questions of the EU Ombudsman as it carries out its investigation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: South Korea announced Monday a plan to compensate Koreans enslaved to work for Japanese companies in Japan

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: during its 35-year colonial rule of the Korean peninsula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The proposal, announced by the foreign ministry, seeks to resolve one of the most contentious issues in the relations between the two countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Japanese government says it appreciates the measures announced as an effort to restore healthy relations between Japan and South Korea.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Although Tokyo insists all wartime compensation issues were settled under the 1965 treaty, Washington for its part has welcomed the agreement it described as historic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But it's not been praised by all.

sentences.sentence: Civic groups and victims protested outside the South Korean Foreign Ministry in Seoul.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: They have expressed their disappointment in the plan, which in principle exempts the Japanese companies from apologising or compensating them directly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Thousands of people packed in old military barracks housing the remains of the iconic socialist leader.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Chavez died on the 5th of March 2013 after a long battle with cancer and handpicked current president, Nicolas Maduro, to be his successor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Since then, Venezuela has been fighting a crisis, aggravated by the collapse of its petrol industry, which has caused 7 million people to emigrate.
